New Records: Carlos Rodon allowed just one run and three hits while striking out nine and walking none in six innings, the most swings and misses by a Yankee pitcher in a postseason game in the pitch-tracking era (since 2008)
Key Match Events: Carlos Rodon pitched six sensational innings, leading the Yankees to a 5-2 victory in Game 1 of the ALCS
Giancarlo Stanton and Juan Soto homered for the Yankees
Brayan Rocchio led off the sixth with a solo homer
Pre-Game Insights: Carlos Rodon made a point of watching how Gerrit Cole handled the emotions, the ups and downs, of an outing
Rodon sought to mimic Cole's calm demeanor and focus on the next pitch
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone praised Rodon's dominant performance, saying it was a good sign for the team
Pitching coach Matt Blake noted that Rodon's outing was huge for everyone, including him, as he was able to put his previous outing behind him
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on a chilly, 50-degree night
The slider was a significant weapon for Rodon, with Cleveland hitters swinging at it 13 times and missing on nine occasions
Others: The Yankees won Game 1 of the ALCS 5-2, with Carlos Rodon earning his first career postseason win
